material.mattext: Which of the following techniques is used to combat the near-far problem in CDMA systems?
What is the purpose of Multi-User Detection (MUD) in wireless communication systems?
Which of the following is an advantage of using antenna arrays in telecommunication systems?
Which technique is used to distinguish and recover multiple user signals in Multi-User Detection (MUD)?
In antenna array systems, beamforming is used to:
Mitigate interference and improve signal quality
What is the primary benefit of employing Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) technology in wireless communication systems?
Which of the following is a commonly used antenna array configuration in MIMO systems?
Which of the following is a challenge associated with Multi-User Detection (MUD) techniques?
Which technique is used to mitigate multi-path fading in antenna array systems?
Which of the following is a commonly used antenna array pattern in wireless communication systems?
In Multi-User Detection (MUD), what is meant by the term "near-far problem"?
Interference caused by users in close proximity
High signal latency in the network
Excessive power consumption by user devices
Insufficient network coverage in rural areas
Which of the following is a key advantage of using CDMA systems in telecommunication?
Which technique is used to separate and detect signals from multiple users in Multi-User Detection (MUD)?
Which of the following is a characteristic of the Multiple-Input Single-Output (MISO) system?
Single antenna at the transmitter and multiple antennas at the receiver
Multiple antennas at the transmitter and receiver
Single antenna at both the transmitter and receiver
No antennas at the transmitter or receiver
Which technique is used to reduce interference between cells in cellular communication systems?
